Author: PTYX#6840
Content: A notary either notarized or doesn't. If they don't fulfil their duties they can be replaced

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: I just run a node of the chain in my server like any other user

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: I just plug a system on top that automates the snapshotting, messaging and synchronization between the notary peers

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: I cant manipulate blocks at all

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: I cant seed up or delay transactions either

Content: Once chain is notarized it will look for the longest chain that has the same notarized block

Content: So its virtually impossible to trick clients into pointing to your chain if you dont have the same notarytxid

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content:
@Geocold51 here's the response i got by lead dev (jl777) why can't do much in the window between notarizations, was afk or i would have posted earlier:
"if the exchange requires more than 3 EMC2 confirms then his deposit wont be accepted
if it is double spent
if it is notarized, then he cant do the deposit
so either way the key is that the exchange requires more deposits than the notarization lag
or best case to use the notarization lag as the required confirmations"

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: now i'm wondering what's the case with DEX? 🤔

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: DEX is in test mode a lot of times during tests

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if you want to spend the resources to 51% a chain for a specific swap, you could if the other side isnt waiting for notarization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the way you make economic gain via 51% attack is to spend the funds, convert it to something else, then erase that (the spend the funds part) but the convert it to something else already happened and presumably you are off to the races to cash that out

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since DEX trades are now for relatively small amounts, it is less than the cost of a 51% attack for the most part

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for production the confirmations logic for barterDEX needs to use the notarization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, the initial notarization to KMD provides a lot of the protection against the reorgs, so no need to wait for the BTC side to complete, still it will prevent attempts to reorg past the notarization

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content:
thanks again, James! 👍 
not much to gain for all the effort and too many easier targets out there to bother
but comforting to know confirmations logic can be added to DEX! 🍾 
i'm sure geocold will get it...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, one step at a time. being the most complex target to attack provides good practical protection, even if it isnt 100% perfect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the variance in lag does provide some times of higher chance for attack to work, but the attacker wont know ahead of time if it is getting into such a high lag period

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the risk of the entire attack just not working with a notarization coming in soon after the private chain is being built... and all that hash down the drain
